intro: Eritrichium pustulosum, commonly known as the pustular eritrichium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its small, puffy flowers are often clustered in racemes, and the leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Eritrichium pustulosum is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
